intro: Solanum mindanaense, commonly known as Mindanao nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching up to 3 meters in height. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are usually white or pale blue. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, yellowish seeds.
